title:
$(\omega, \alpha, n)$-sensitivity and limit sets of zero entropy
  homeomorphisms on the square
authors: Jiehua Mai, Enhui Shi, Kesong Yan, Fanping Zeng
abstract:
For a homeomorphism $f$ of a compact metric space $X$ and a positive integer
$n\geq 2$, we introduce the notion of $(\omega, \alpha, n)$-sensitivity of $f$,
which describes such a kind of chaos: there is some $c>0$ such that for any
$x\in X$ and any open neighborhood $U$ of $x$, there are points
$\{x_i\}_{i=1}^n$ and $\{y_i\}_{i=1}^n$ in $U$ such that both the collection of
$\omega$-limit sets $\omega(x_i, f)$ and that of the $\alpha$-limit sets
$\alpha(y_i, f)$ are pairwise $c$-separated. Then we construct a class of
homeomorphisms of the square $[-1, 1]^2$ which are $(\omega, \alpha,
n)$-sensitive for any $n\geq 2$ and have zero topological entropies. To
investigate further the complexity of zero entropy homeomorphisms by using
limit sets, we analyze in depth the limit sets of square homeomorphisms by the
boundary permeating technique. Specially, we prove that for any given set of
points $Y\equiv\{y_{n1}, y_{n2}:n\in\mathbb N\}$ in $(-1, 1)^2$ which satisfies
some loosely technical conditions, and for any given family of pairwise
disjoint countable dense subsets $\{W_n:n\in\mathbb N\}$ of $(-1, 1)^2-Y$,
there is a zero entropy homeomorphism $f$ on the square $[-1, 1]^2$ such that
$\omega(x, f)=\{y_{n1}\}$ and $\alpha(x, f)=\{y_{n2}\}$ for any $n$ and any
$x\in W_n$.
